authors: Professor, Department of Radiology, LTM Medical College and LTMG Hospital, Mumbai, Maharashtra.
Professor and Head, Department of Medicine.
text: Ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome is usually an iatrogenic complication in women taking ovulation induction medications during assisted reproduction. We hereby report the case of a 25 years old female who presented with hypertension, polyserositis with tense ascites and large cystic ovaries. She developed sigmoid and transverse sinus thrombosis. She had undergone a clandestine ovulation induction therapy as a commercial ovum donor. She fitted in severe category of ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome.
title: Life-threatening Medical Complications Due to Ovarian Hyperstimulation Syndrome: A Hidden Etiology.
journal: The Journal of the Association of Physicians of India
